content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Given a DataFrame df_cars with column `model`, write a function `count_model_rows` that groups data by model and calculate how many rows there are for each.

```julia
function count_model_rows(df_cars::DataFrame))
    grouped_data = df_cars.group_by("model"))
    
    row_counts = zeros(size(grouped_data)))) # Initialize row counts to zeros
    
    for idx, group in enumerate(grouped_data)))) # Iterate over each group
    
        row_count = row_counts[idx]] # Get the current row count for this group
    
        # Calculate how many rows there are for each
        if length(group)) > 1 # If the group has more than one row, calculate the number of rows and add it to the row count
        else # Otherwise, if the group only contains one row, do not calculate the number of rows and simply add the row count.
        end
    
        row_counts[idx]] = row_count # Update the current row count for this group with the new calculated row count
